channel.title: grpc on {code that works}
channel.description: Recent content in grpc on {code that works}

item.title: Command line clients for gRPC - polyglot
item.description: Polyglot was the second gRPC client that I looked at. One of the things that I liked about it is the fact that it does not need users to generate protoset files. It generates the protoset files in flight every time it runs. This, combined with the fact that it is written in Java does have a disadvantage - every time the client makes a call, it has to fire up a JVM, generate protosets and make the request.

item.title: Command line clients for gRPC - grpcurl
item.description: We are in the middle of considering replacing JSON over HTTP with gRPC for communication between our internal services. One of my concerns about this was how we would be able to debug and poke around things in a world where we will no longer be able to use cURL. I have been looking at cURL like command line utilities we can use to replace most of the capabilities, if not all of cURL. So far, I have looked at grpcurl, grpc_cli and polyglot .In these blog posts, we will try and compare these tools.
